private_information: I have the obfuscated action names and their preconditions and effects as stated by the user
I can map predicate patterns and infer candidate predicate signatures and typing for objects
schema_interpreter.goal: Produce a clear, unambiguous schema-level description of predicates, object sets, and action templates that another agent can simulate with.

private_information: I can use action templates and current facts to propose sequences of actions
I am allowed to propose partial plans that respect known preconditions and effects
simulator.goal: Propose plausible action sequences and intermediate facts that lead from the initial facts to the requested goal facts.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency analysis
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral quota tokens or post-hoc penalties and enforce explicit causal links
auditor.goal: Audit proposed schemas and plans to ensure causal consistency and remove any bookkeeping shortcuts, and provide a corrected specification for the orchestrator.

private_information: I integrate analysis, proposed plans, and audit reports to produce the final planning problem specification
The final output must be a PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from other agents and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that FastDownwards can solve to achieve the stated goal facts.

init.note: Objects are named object_0 through object_12

public_information: Available actions with their argument arities: paltry takes three objects paltry object_0 object_1 object_2, sip takes three objects sip object_0 object_1 object_2, clip takes three objects clip object_0 object_1 object_2, wretched takes four objects wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3, memory takes three objects memory object_0 object_1 object_2, tightfisted takes three objects tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2
Action preconditions and effects are provided in an obfuscated style and must be mapped to clear predicates

Initial facts include cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_5, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8
Goal facts to achieve are next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_9 object_5

Action descriptions summarized: paltry requires hand obj0 cats obj1 texture obj2 vase obj0 obj1 next obj1 obj2; performing paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and vase obj0 obj1 false. sip requires hand obj0 cats obj1 texture obj2 next obj0 obj2 next obj1 obj2; performing sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and next obj0 obj2 false. clip requires hand obj0 sneeze obj1 texture obj2 next obj1 obj2 next obj0 obj2; performing clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and next obj0 obj2 false. wretched requires sneeze obj0 texture obj1 texture obj2 stupendous obj3 next obj0 obj1 collect obj1 obj3 collect obj2 obj3; performing wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false. memory requires cats obj0 spring obj1 spring obj2 next obj0 obj1; performing memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false. tightfisted requires hand obj0 sneeze obj1 texture obj2 next obj1 obj2 vase obj0 obj1; performing tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a schema interpreter. Your role is to read obfuscated action descriptions and initial facts and output a clear structured description of predicates, candidate types for objects, and normalized action templates listing formal preconditions and effects. Do not emit PDDL. Provide typed predicate signatures and a mapping from the obfuscated names to those predicates. Explicitly note any ambiguities that need resolution.
analyze.prompt: You are schema_interpreter. Here is the public information about actions and facts as provided by the environment. Use that information and your private knowledge to produce a schema level model that lists predicates and action templates and that points out ambiguous name collisions or missing typing information. The orchestrator and simulator will consume your model.

propose.system_prompt: You are a causal simulator. Using the schema model provided by the schema interpreter and the initial facts from the environment, you should produce candidate action sequences or plan fragments that attempt to reach the goal facts. You may produce multiple alternative fragments and indicate required intermediate facts. Do not emit PDDL. Keep actions distinct and use the normalized action templates from the schema interpreter.
propose.prompt: You are simulator. Use the schema_interpreter_model and the environment public information to produce plausible ordered action sequences and the intermediate facts they establish. Highlight required object bindings and any steps that rely on ambiguous mappings.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specializing in temporal and causal consistency. Your job is to examine the schema model and proposed plan fragments and to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral quota tokens or post hoc penalties. Convert any implicit shortcuts into explicit causal steps. Flag cycles and impossible precondition chains. Provide a corrected and conservative model and annotated plan fragments. Do not output PDDL.
audit.prompt: You are auditor. Review the schema_interpreter_model and simulator_plan_fragment. Produce a report that ensures all causal links are explicit, all temporal ordering constraints are valid, and that no bookkeeping shortcuts remain. Offer fixes or alternative steps where necessary.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the schema model, the simulator fragments, and the auditor report to create a single coherent PDDL domain and problem. Keep agent actions distinct if they correspond to different roles. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Use constructs supported by FastDownwards and avoid reliance on bookkeeping shortcuts.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Use inputs from the other agents to write a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that captures the predicates, action templates, initial facts, and the goal facts next object_10 object_8 next object_11 object_6 next object_12 object_8 next object_9 object_5. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
